Name: Electric Load Data

Caption.String: Click Download Electric Load Data to run a macro that downloads modeled hourly load data. See Help for details.

Description.String: Type a load growth rate (%) for each year. Each year's growth rate applies to the total annual load in Year 1.

Tool Tip.String: Click Edit Array to import time series electric load data.

Description.String: The electric load power is the average power over the time interval.  For hourly load data, this is equivalent to entering energy usage in each hour in kWh.

Caption.String: These monthly and annual values are calculated from the hourly or subhourly load profile and shown here for reference.
Scale electric load profile to monthly usage
Adjust Load Profile to Monthly Usage

Electric load data describes the electricity usage of a building or facility for electricity bill calculations. Enter or import an hourly or subhourly load profile and use the adjustment options to scale the profile or to account for annual load growth. See Help for details.

Tool Tip.String: Type a fixed scaling factor to adjust the hourly load profile. Type a '1' for no scaling.

Tips.String: Type a tip here or define in runtime/help/tooltips.json

normalize_to_utility_bill.Label: Scale monthly electric load to monthly usage

Equations: const calc_monthly = define( load, crit_ts, crit_pct, mload, mpeak, mcrit, is_crit )
// one of crit_ts(kW) and crit_pct (%) must be 0
nsub = #load/8760; // number of subhourly steps per hour
// not ideal, but need a way to check for critical load when Grid Outage Critical Load page is not in configuration
is_critical_load_tech = ( tech == 'PV Battery' || tech == 'Standalone Battery' || tech == 'Generic Battery' || tech == 'Fuel Cell'
|| tech == 'CustomGeneration PVWatts Wind FuelCell Battery Hybrid' );
// arrays for monthly load (kWh) and peak (kW)
//STOP HERE IF NOT ENTERING  DATA- EITHER NO LOAD OR CALCULATED BY BELPE
// READ IN USER SUPPLIED DATA (8760 or multiple of 8760)
// stop here if data is not multiple of 8760 to prevent callback error
// could happen if 'load_user_data' is set in script to incorrect value
//APPLY MONTHLY LOAD SCALING- WILL OVERWRITE SCALING FACTOR
// determine monthly load, no need for critical load calcs
// mcrit should be array of zeros if no critical load
calc_monthly( load, 0, 0, mload, mpeak, mcrit, is_critical_load_tech );
//compute the scaling factor necessary for each month
// scale load profile with value provided by user
if (${crit_load_type} == 1) // time series critical load data
else // critical load as percent of electric load data
// determine monthly loads and peaks from
calc_monthly( load, crit_ts, crit_pct, mload, mpeak, mcrit, is_critical_load_tech );
// save outputs to variables in UI
// critical load data should be set to zero if no critical load
Callbacks: if (!ok) {msgbox('Macro failed!\n The macro \"' + macro_name + '\"may not be available for this configuration. Try clicking Macros under the Simulate button.');}
msg = 'These monthly and annual values are calculated from the hourly or subhourly load profile and shown here for reference.';
msg = msg + ' Critical load data is from the Grid Outage page.';
is_critical_load_tech = ( tech == 'PV Battery' || tech == 'Standalone Battery' || tech == 'Generic Battery' || tech == 'Fuel Cell' );
// error if load data not multiple of 8760
// could happen if load_user_data set by script
+'Electric load data length must be a multiple of 8760.\n'
return; // avoid displaying multple error messages
// error if user critical load not multiple of 8760
// or different length than load data
+'Electric load data and critical load data must use the same time step:\n'
+'  Electric load time step is ' + 8760/#${load_user_data}*60 + ' minutes.\n'
+'  Critical load time step is '  + 8760/#${crit_load_user_data}*60 + ' minutes.\n\n'
+'See Grid Outage page for critical load data and Electric Load page for electric load data.');
